Reason: Cryptocurrency mining is directly linked to blockchain technology (like distributed ledgers), whereas self-driving cars operate on AI and sensor-based systems.
Remote surgery utilizes robotic systems controlled by doctors over a network, while large language models focus on processing natural language rather than specific medical procedures.

Agricultural technology is designed to improve farming efficiency and sustainability, whereas virtual reality software is typically aimed at creating immersive digital experiences, unrelated to farming.

Self-driving vehicles depend heavily on AI algorithms and real-time sensor data, whereas additive manufacturing (3D printing) focuses on creating physical objects layer by layer, without any connection to autonomous mobility.
GPUs are integral to powering AI models and computations, but 3D printers are used in fabrication processes, which do not require AI processing power.
Multi-factor authentication is a cybersecurity method aimed at ensuring user identity, while nanoscale technology is concerned with manipulating materials at the molecular level.
Soundwave printing is an innovative form of additive manufacturing, but teledentistry focuses on delivering dental care remotely and does not involve printing technologies.
Augmented reality glasses are tools for enhancing digital interactions with the physical world, while aquaponics is a method for sustainable farming, far removed from virtual reality applications.
Nanoscale technology involves manipulating materials on an atomic scale, which differs fundamentally from bitcoin mining, an activity centered around blockchain computations.

Digitalized manufacturing transforms production through automation and real-time data analysis, while identity management systems focus on securing access and verifying users, with no overlap in manufacturing processes.
